        I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs.         Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;

          margin-bottom: 0.25em;

            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }

  :host {
    --mr-edit-field-padding: 0.125em 4px;
    --mr-edit-field-width: 90%;

    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
    color: var(--chops-primary-font-color);
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /** Converts a <button> to look like an <a> tag. */
  .linkify {
    display: inline;
    padding: 0;
    margin: 0;
    border: 0;
    background: 0;
    cursor: pointer;
  }
  h1, h2, h3, h4 {
    background: none;
  }
  a, chops-button, a.button, .button, .linkify {
    color: var(--chops-link-color);
    text-decoration: none;
    font-weight: var(--chops-link-font-weight);
    font-family: var(--chops-font-family);
  }
  a:hover, .linkify:hover {
    text-decoration: underline;
  }
  a.button, .button {
    /* Links that look like buttons. */
    display: inline-flex;
    align-items: center;
    justify-content: center;
    text-decoration: none;
    transition: filter 0.3s ease-in-out, box-shadow 0.3s ease-in-out;
  }
  a.button:hover, .button:hover {
    filter: brightness(95%);
  }
  chops-button, a.button, .button {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
    background: var(--chops-white);
    border-radius: 6px;
    --chops-button-padding: 0.25em 8px;
    margin: 0;
    margin-left: auto;
  }

    padding: var(--chops-button-padding);
  }

    display: block;
    margin-right: 4px;
  }
  chops-button.emphasized, a.button.emphasized, .button.emphasized {
    background: var(--chops-primary-button-bg);
    color: var(--chops-primary-button-color);
    text-shadow: 1px 1px 3px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.25);
  }
  textarea, select, input {
    box-sizing: border-box;
    font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
  }
  /* Note: decoupling heading levels from styles is useful for
  * accessibility because styles will not always line up with semantically
  * appropriate heading levels.
  */
  .medium-heading {
    font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
    font-weight: normal;
    line-height: 1;

    grid-template-columns: minmax(120px, max-content) 1fr;
    align-items: flex-start;
  }

    font-weight: bold;
    text-align: right;
    word-wrap: break-word;

      grid-gap: var(--mr-input-grid-gap);
      grid-template-columns: 100%;

          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
        }
        main {
          border-top: var(--chops-normal-border);
        }
        .snackbar-container {
          position: fixed;
          bottom: 1em;
          left: 1em;
          display: flex;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: flex-start;
          z-index: 1000;
        }
        /** Unfix <chops-snackbar> to allow stacking. */
        chops-snackbar {
          position: static;
          margin-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .project-alert {
          background: var(--chops-orange-50);
          color: var(--chops-field-error-color);
          display: block;
          font-weight: bold;
          text-align: center;
        }
      </style>


      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">
      
      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>

    <mr-cue centered="" cueprefname="search_for_numbers" hidden=""></mr-cue>


          
      
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        testcase has a visual difference bisect to:<span class="line"><!---->testcase has a visual difference bisect to:<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/84089d8020cbbea1b98391112571c0e8a0d2dcd7..031537c99401e6d15ca31c65d458ade1b2e17a55<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/84089d8020cbbea1b98391112571c0e8a0d2dcd7..031537c99401e6d15ca31c65d458ade1b2e17a55"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+log/84089d8020cbbea1b98391112571c0e8a0d2dcd7..031537c99401e6d15ca31c65d458ade1b2e17a55<!----></a><br><br>likely:<span class="line"><!---->likely:<!----></span><br>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49eee564f82353d611e18b76df17a94489d97362<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49eee564f82353d611e18b76df17a94489d97362"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src/+/49eee564f82353d611e18b76df17a94489d97362<!----></a><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a>, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<span class="line"><!---->As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<!----></span><br><br>Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <span class="line"><!---->Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <!----></span>#c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->#c7<!----></a> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. (Thanks for that atotic@ and ikilpatrick@).<span class="line"><!----> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4.         even though this is a relatively small fix, since the CL just landed earlier today, going to let this get a bit more bake time in canary before approving for stable channel merge; plan is to revisit tomorrow before refresh cut deadline and may request a quick merge so that this can be included in next week's stable security refresh. Please let me know if you have any issues or concerns about this. Thanks!<span class="line"><!---->even though this is a relatively small fix, since the CL just landed earlier today, going to let this get a bit more bake time in canary before approving for stable channel merge; plan is to revisit tomorrow before refresh cut deadline and may request a quick merge so that this can be included in next week's stable security refresh. Please let me know if you have any issues or concerns about this. Thanks!<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.

    <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>

        for LitElement.

      <input id="filter" type="text">

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }
      </style>

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

      
      
        
          <slot></slot>
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      <dialog class="dialog" role="dialog">
        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        This bug requires manual review: We are only 12 days from stable.<span class="line"><!---->This bug requires manual review: We are only 12 days from stable.<!----></span><br>Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<span class="line"><!---->Before a merge request will be considered, the following information is required to be added to this bug:<!----></span><br><br>1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. <span class="line"><!---->commit <!----></span>5faefef3cad58252227bb6c9ffae9b129f5b3685<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/5faefef3cad58252227bb6c9ffae9b129f5b3685"><!---->5faefef3cad58252227bb6c9ffae9b129f5b3685<!----></a><br>Author: Koji Ishii <<span class="line"><!---->Author: Koji Ishii &lt;<!----></span>kojii@chromium.org<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="/u/kojii@chromium.org"><!---->kojii@chromium.org<!----></a>><span class="line"><!---->&gt;<!----></span><br>Date: Wed Sep 08 23:36:14 2021<span class="line"><!---->Date: Wed Sep 08 23:36:14 2021<!----></span><br><br>Merge 4606: Apply list item quirks only when the nested list is block-level<span class="line"><!---->Merge 4606: Apply list item quirks only when the nested list is block-level<!----></span><br><br>This patch changes to apply quirks for a list-item occupying<span class="line"><!---->This patch changes to apply quirks for a list-item occupying<!----></span><br>the whole line only if the nested list is block-level.<span class="line"><!---->the whole line only if the nested list is block-level.<!----></span><br><br>When applying this quirks, list markers are handled like a<span class="line"><!---->When applying this quirks, list markers are handled like a<!----></span><br>regular child. <span class="line"><!---->regular child. <!----></span>r883403<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/883403"><!---->r883403<!----></a> <span class="line"><!----> <!----></span>crrev.com/c/2885398<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/c/2885398"><!---->crrev.com/c/2885398<!----></a> changed to handle<span class="line"><!----> changed to handle<!----></span><br>list markers at |NGBlockLayoutAlgorithm| to support NG block<span class="line"><!---->list markers at |NGBlockLayoutAlgorithm| to support NG block<!----></span><br>fragmentation. These two when combined causes the list marker<span class="line"><!---->fragmentation. These two when combined causes the list marker<!----></span><br>not laid out if the nested list is not block-level.<span class="line"><!---->not laid out if the nested list is not block-level.<!----></span><br><br>This may change some visual behaviors, but I think this is ok:<span class="line"><!---->This may change some visual behaviors, but I think this is         I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);

          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

          

          <div class="edit-actions">
            <chops-button class="de-emphasized">
              Cancel
            </chops-button>
            <chops-button class="emphasized">
               issue
            </chops-button>
          </div>
        </div>

      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);

           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */

        for LitElement.

      <style>
        mr-issue-page {

          flex-shrink: 0;

          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));

        mr-launch-overview {

              <mr-issue-details class="main-item"><!---->
      <style>
        mr-issue-details {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background-color: var(--chops-white);
          padding-bottom: 1em;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          flex-direction: column;
          margin: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
        }

        mr-issue-page {
          --mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding: 12px;
          --mr-toggled-font-family: inherit;
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-open-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[issueClosed] {
          --monorail-metadata-toggled-bg: var(--monorail-metadata-closed-bg);
        }
        mr-issue-page[codeFont] {
          --mr-toggled-font-family: Monospace;
        }
        .container-issue {
          width: 100%;
          flex-direction: column;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: flex-start;
          z-index: 200;
        }
        .container-issue-content {
          padding: 0;
          flex-grow: 1;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: nowrap;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          padding-top: 0.5em;
        }
        .container-outside {
          box-sizing: border-box;
          width: 100%;
          max-width: 100%;
          margin: auto;
          padding: 0;
          display: flex;
          align-items: stretch;
          justify-content: space-between;
          flex-direction: row;
          flex-wrap: no-wrap;
        }
        .container-no-issue {
          padding: 0.5em 16px;
          font-size: var(--chops-large-font-size);
        }
        .metadata-container {
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          background: var(--monorail-metadata-toggled-bg);
          border-right: var(--chops-normal-border);
          border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          width: 24em;
          min-width: 256px;
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          z-index: 100;
        }
        .issue-header-container {
          z-index: 10;
          position: sticky;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          margin-bottom: 0.25em;
          width: 100%;
        }
        mr-issue-details {
          min-width: 50%;
          max-width: 1000px;
          flex-grow: 1;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
        }
        mr-issue-metadata {
          position: sticky;
          overflow-y: auto;
          top: var(--monorail-header-height);
          height: calc(100vh - var(--monorail-header-height));
        }
        mr-launch-overview {
          border-left: var(--chops-normal-border);
          padding-left: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          padding-right: var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          flex-grow: 0;
          flex-shrink: 0;
          width: 50%;
          box-sizing: border-box;
          min-height: 100%;
        }
        @media (max-width: 1126px) {
          .container-issue-content {
            flex-direction: column;
            padding: 0 var(--mr-issue-page-horizontal-padding);
          }
          mr-issue-details, mr-launch-overview {
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
        }
        @media (max-width: 840px) {
          .container-outside {
            flex-direction: column;
          }
          .metadata-container {
            width: 100%;
            height: auto;
            border: 0;
            border-bottom: var(--chops-normal-border);
          }
          mr-issue-metadata {
            min-width: auto;
            max-width: auto;
            width: 100%;
            padding: 0;
            min-height: 0;
            border: 0;
          }
          mr-issue-metadata, .issue-header-container {
            position: static;
          }
        }

        Email display settings<h2>Email display settings</h2>

        There is a setting<a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.<p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.<p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to get
        involved<a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.<p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>
    
            Got it
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="privacyDialog" forced="">
        <h2>Email display settings</h2>

        <p>There is a <a href="/hosting/settings">setting</a> to control how
        your email address appears on comments and issues that you post.</p>

        <p>Project members will always see your full email address.  By
        default, other users who visit the site will see an
        abbreviated version of your email address.</p>

        <p>If you do not wish your email address to be shared, there
        are other ways to <a href="http://www.chromium.org/getting-involved">get
        involved</a> in the community.  To report a problem when using
        the Chrome browser, you may use the "Report an issue..."  item
        on the "Help" menu.</p>


        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      </chops-dialog>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>

        <div class="dialog-content">
          <slot></slot>
        </div>
      </dialog>
    
        This site hosts public issues in public projects<h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.<p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.<p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        

        
          
      
        <slot></slot>
      <button>
        <slot></slot>
      </button>

          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        <div class="edit-actions">
          <chops-button>
            Got it
          </chops-button>
        </div>
      <chops-dialog id="corpModeDialog" forced="">
        <h2>This site hosts public issues in public projects</h2>

        <p>Unlike our internal issue tracker, this site makes most
        issues public, unless the issue is labeled with a Restrict-View-*
        label, such as Restrict-View-Google.</p>

        <p>Components are not used for permissions.  And, regardless of
        restriction labels, the issue reporter, owner,
        and Cc'd users may always view the issue.</p>

        I hit the DCHECK running the test case under asan, or debug.<span class="line"><!---->I hit the DCHECK running the test case under asan, or debug.<!----></span><br><br>LayoutNGOutsideListMarker does not get laid out.<span class="line"><!---->LayoutNGOutsideListMarker does not get laid out.<!----></span><br><br>LayoutView 0x333c00a01f70              	#document<span class="line"><!---->LayoutView 0x333c00a01f70              	#document<!----></span><br>  LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02288     	HTML<span class="line"><!---->  LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02288     	HTML<!----></span><br>    LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02510   	BODY<span class="line"><!---->    LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02510   	BODY<!----></span><br>      LayoutNGBlockFlow (anonymous) 0x333c00a02938<span class="line"><!---->      LayoutNGBlockFlow (anonymous) 0x333c00a02938<!----></span><br>        LayoutText 0x333c00a026a8      	#text "a"<span class="line"><!---->        LayoutText 0x333c00a026a8      	#text "a"<!----></span><br>      LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a027a0 	UL<span class="line"><!---->      LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a027a0 	UL<!----></span><br>        LayoutNGListItem 0x333c00a02ad0	LI<span class="line"><!---->        LayoutNGListItem 0x333c00a02ad0	LI<!----></span><br>*         LayoutNGOutsideListMarker 0x333c00a02c70	::marker<span class="line"><!---->*         LayoutNGOutsideListMarker 0x333c00a02c70	::marker<!----></span><br>            LayoutText (anonymous) 0x333c00a02e10<span class="line"><!---->            LayoutText (anonymous) 0x333c00a02e10<!----></span><br>          LayoutNGBlockFlow (floating) 0x333c00a02f08	UL style="float:left;w"<span class="line"><!---->          LayoutNGBlockFlow (floating) 0x333c00a02f08	UL style="float:left;w"<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

        I hit the DCHECK running the test case under asan, or debug.<span class="line"><!---->I hit the DCHECK running the test case under asan, or debug.<!----></span><br><br>LayoutNGOutsideListMarker does not get laid out.<span class="line"><!---->LayoutNGOutsideListMarker does not get laid out.<!----></span><br><br>LayoutView 0x333c00a01f70              	#document<span class="line"><!---->LayoutView 0x333c00a01f70              	#document<!----></span><br>  LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02288     	HTML<span class="line"><!---->  LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02288     	HTML<!----></span><br>    LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02510   	BODY<span class="line"><!---->    LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a02510   	BODY<!----></span><br>      LayoutNGBlockFlow (anonymous) 0x333c00a02938<span class="line"><!---->      LayoutNGBlockFlow (anonymous) 0x333c00a02938<!----></span><br>        LayoutText 0x333c00a026a8      	#text "a"<span class="line"><!---->        LayoutText 0x333c00a026a8      	#text "a"<!----></span><br>      LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a027a0 	UL<span class="line"><!---->      LayoutNGBlockFlow 0x333c00a027a0 	UL<!----></span><br>        LayoutNGListItem 0x333c00a02ad0	LI<span class="line"><!---->        LayoutNGListItem 0x333c00a02ad0	LI<!----></span><br>*         LayoutNGOutsideListMarker 0x333c00a02c70	::marker<span class="line"><!---->*         LayoutNGOutsideListMarker 0x333c00a02c70	::marker<!----></span><br>            LayoutText (anonymous) 0x333c00a02e10<span class="line"><!---->            LayoutText (anonymous) 0x333c00a02e10<!----></span><br>          LayoutNGBlockFlow (floating) 0x333c00a02f08	UL style="float:left;w"<span class="line"><!---->          LayoutNGBlockFlow (floating) 0x333c00a02f08	UL style="float:left;w"<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>

        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        </div>

            Issue 1246932: Security DCHECK failed: layout_object.h: !NeedsLayout() || ChildLayoutBlockedByDisplayLock()
          <h1>

            Reported by
            
      <link href="https://fonts.googleapis.com/icon?family=Material+Icons" rel="stylesheet">

Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<span class="line"><!---->As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<!----></span><br><br>Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <span class="line"><!---->Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <!----></span>#c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->#c7<!----></a> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. (Thanks for that atotic@ and ikilpatrick@).<span class="line"><!----> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. (Thanks for that atotic@ and ikilpatrick@).<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4.         I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        <div>
          <a class="comment-link" href="?id=1246932#c34">Comment 34<!----></a>

          
        by
        <mr-user-link></mr-user-link>

          Labels:<strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-0
          
          <br>
        
        
      <div class="issue-diff">
        <!---->
          <strong><!---->Labels:</strong>
          
          -reward-topanel reward-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a>, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<span class="line"><!---->As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<!----></span><br><br>Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <span class="line"><!---->Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <!----></span>#c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->#c7<!----></a> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. (Thanks for that atotic@ and ikilpatrick@).<span class="line"><!----> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. a<!----></span><br>regular child. <span class="line"><!---->regular child. <!----></span>r883403<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://crrev.com/883403"><!---->r883403<!----></a> <span
