block<!----></span><br>fragmentation. These two when combined causes the list marker<span class="line"><!---->fragmentation. These two when combined causes the list marker<!----></span><br>not laid out if the nested list is not block-level.<span class="line"><!---->not laid out if the nested list is not block-level.<!----></span><br><br>This may change some visual behaviors, but I think this is ok:<span class="line"><!---->This may change some visual behaviors, but I think this is         I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Re <span class="line"><!---->Re <!----></span>#c5<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c5"><!---->#c5<!----></a>, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<span class="line"><!---->, thanks attekett@. Yeah, ClusterFuzz should normally have security DCHECKs enabled (I thought) so I've e-mailed the ClusterFuzz team to try to find out what's up and why it didn't register as a crash even though it reproduced the stack trace.<!----></span><br><br>As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<span class="line"><!---->As this is a security DCHECK I'm going to assume this would result in renderer memory corruption in a release build, and rate this Security_Severity-High.<!----></span><br><br>Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <span class="line"><!---->Normally we'd rely on ClusterFuzz to bisect here and identify the correct FoundIn label, but it sounds like <!----></span>#c7<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c7"><!---->#c7<!----></a> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. (Thanks for that atotic@ and ikilpatrick@).<span class="line"><!----> reckons this has existed since slightly before M93 branched. Setting labels appropriately. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<span class="line"><!---->1. Does your merge fit within the Merge Decision Guidelines?<!----></span><br>- Chrome: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome: <!----></span>https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge"><!---->https://chromium.googlesource.com/chromium/src.git/+/main/docs/process/merge_request.md#when-to-request-a-merge<!----></a><br>- Chrome OS: <span class="line"><!---->- Chrome OS: <!----></span>https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines"><!---->https://goto.google.com/cros-release-branch-merge-guidelines<!----></a><br>2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<span class="line"><!---->2. Links to the CLs you are requesting to merge.<!----></span><br>3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<span class="line"><!---->3. Has the change landed and been verified on ToT?<!----></span><br>4. Does this change need to be merged into other active release branches (M-1, M+1)?<span class="line"><!---->4. If it is a new feature, is it behind a flag using finch?<!----></span><br><br>Chrome OS Only:<span class="line"><!---->Chrome OS Only:<!----></span><br>8. block<!----></span><br>fragmentation.         I discussed <span class="line"><!---->I discussed <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<span class="line"><!----> with inferno@. He says that the security DCHECK is hit in a section of the ClusterFuzz output which relates only to beta (under a section heading "+----------------------------------------Beta Build Stacktrace----------------------------------------+"). He says that ClusterFuzz was unable to reproduce the security DCHECK against trunk, which is why it gave slightly odd output.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

        Related to <span class="line"><!---->Related to <!----></span>#c8<a class="undefined" target="_blank" href="#c8"><!---->#c8<!----></a>, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<span class="line"><!---->, adetaylor@ mentioned that ClusterFuzz has Security DCHECKs enabled on release builds? Are those builds available publicly? I have found asan-(release|debug), msan, ubsan, vptr, but only debug has Security DCHECKs. Those release builds would probably be a better option for fuzzing than a full debug build, but I would like to avoid having to make custom builds.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>

          -reward-topanel reward-0
          
          <br>
        <!---->
        
      </div><br>
    
        
      
        Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <span class="line"><!---->Discussing this issue with the developer (kojii@) while the severity of "!NeedsLayout" security DCHECK can vary,  in many cases they are not security failures, but there might be some cases they are. It does not appear that this issue can lead to memory corruption. <!----></span><br>As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<span class="line"><!---->As this issue does not appear to be a security bug, the VRP Panel declines to extend a reward for this report. If you can demonstrate exploitability that would lead to a memory corruption or other security impact, please do let us know and we are happy to reassess this issue for a potential VRP reward. Thank you.<!----></span><mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        
          
        <div>
          
        </div>
      <div class="comment-body">
        <mr-comment-content></mr-comment-content>
        <div>
          
        </div>

           issue<h3 class="medium-heading"><!----> issue</h3>
          
            Target project:<label for="targetProjectInput">Target project:</label>
            
              <input id="targetProjectInput" aria-owns="chops-autocomplete-1" aria-autocomplete="both" aria-expanded="false" aria-haspopup="listbox" aria-activedescendant="">
              
      
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }

              <mr-autocomplete vocabularyname="project" for="targetProjectInput" role="listbox" id="chops-autocomplete-1"><!---->
      <style>
        /*
         * Really specific class names are necessary because ShadowDOM
         * is disabled for this component.
         */
        .chops-autocomplete-container {
          position: relative;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container table {
          padding: 0;
          font-size: var(--chops-main-font-size);
          color: var(--chops-link-color);
          position: absolute;
          background: var(--chops-white);
          border: var(--chops-accessible-border);
          z-index: 999;
          box-shadow: 2px 3px 8px 0px hsla(0, 0%, 0%, 0.3);
          border-spacing: 0;
          border-collapse: collapse;
          /* In the case when the autocomplete extends the
           * height of the viewport, we want to make sure
           * there's spacing. */
          margin-bottom: 1em;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tbody {
          display: block;
          min-width: 100px;
          max-height: 500px;
          overflow: auto;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr {
          cursor: pointer;
          transition: background 0.2s ease-in-out;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container tr[data-selected] {
          background: var(--chops-active-choice-bg);
          text-decoration: underline;
        }
        .chops-autocomplete-container td {
          padding: 0.25em 8px;
          white-space: nowrap;
        }
        .screenreader-hidden {
          clip: rect(1px, 1px, 1px, 1px);
          height: 1px;
          overflow: hidden;
          position: absolute;
          white-space: nowrap;
          width: 1px;
        }
      </style>
      <div class="chops-autocomplete-container">
        <span class="screenreader-hidden" aria-live="polite">
          
        </span>
        <table hidden="">
          <tbody>
            
          </tbody>
        </table>
      </div>
    <!----></mr-autocomplete>
            </div>
          </div>

       Note: Avoiding 2-way data binding to futureproof this code
        for LitElement. 
      <input id="checkbox" type="checkbox">

// Load and instantiate pRPC client before any other script.
window.prpcClient = new AutoRefreshPrpcClient(
 CS_env.token, CS_env.tokenExpiresSec);

 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
<script type="text/javascript" nonce="">
 runOnLoad(function() {
 if (typeof(ClientLogger) === "function") {
 let cl = new ClientLogger("issues");
 if (cl.started("new-issue")) {
 cl.logEnd("new-issue", null, 120 * 1000);
 }
 if (cl.started("issue-search")) {
 cl.logEnd("issue-search");
 }
 }
 });
</script>
